page.title: 01THE PILOT AND SURROUNDINGS
page.content: This is a true 'upland grassland' area, despite its proximity to the coast, which ccan be attributed to comparatively high elevation and consequently increased precipitation. The western section is formed by the perimeter of a gently rolling plateau, comprising of grass moorland vegetation, which is poorly drained with peaty soils. To the east the area is more undulating, again mainly grass moorland, but with coniferous forest on the higher slopes and some fringe areas of enclosed rough grazing. It is a geographically isolated area, the land only being used as upland rough grazing and increasingly forestry. there are no 'services' as such and only one minor road cuts across the area which id nethertheless an important access route for forestry development.
